pullRequest.body:
The proposed lemma unfolds the `toEuclideanLin` definition to express action of a matrix on a vector, without defeq abuse.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
maintainer merge

(I also suggested this to Jon)
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by j-loreaux.

:v: j-loreaux can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Yeah, the bot tricked me into doing a bunch of weird things...including
accidentally replacing the proof of my original lemma. Jireh helped me roll
these back. Good to know the suggestions aren't any good. Live and learn!

On Wed, Apr 17, 2024 at 7:55 PM Eric Wieser ***@***.***>
wrote:

> ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/Analysis/InnerProductSpace/PiL2.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11988#discussion_r1569691501>
> :
>
> > @@ -1028,6 +1028,21 @@
>    rfl
>  #align matrix.pi_Lp_equiv_to_euclidean_lin Matrix.piLp_equiv_toEuclideanLin
>
> +theorem toEuclideanLin_apply (M : Matrix m n 𝕜) (v : EuclideanSpace 𝕜 n) :
> +    toEuclideanLin M v =
> +      (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ (WithLp.equiv 2 (n → 𝕜)) v) :=
> +  rfl
> +
> ***@***.***
> +theorem Matrix.piLp_equiv_symm_toEuclideanLin_apply (M : Matrix m n 𝕜) (v : EuclideanSpace 𝕜 n) :
> +   WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜) (toEuclideanLin M v) = (M *ᵥ (WithLp.equiv 2 (n → 𝕜)) v) :=
>
> In fact, I think every one of these bot comments is garbage; it should
> only be suggesting whitespace changes.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11988#discussion_r1569691501>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AOJJJTU4IRWWXV3I7XKPCLLY54DYVAVCNFSM6AAAAABF3LECSKVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43YUDVNRWFEZLROVSXG5CSMV3GSZLXHMZDAMBXGU3DKMZXGA>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8740780567/job/23985238394)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8740780567/job/23985237830)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8740780567/job/23985238108)

I recommend also adding one or both of
```lean
WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜) (toEuclideanLin M v) = M *ᵥ WithLp.equiv 2 (n → 𝕜)) v :=
```
```lean
(v' : m → 𝕜) :
    toEuclideanLin M ((WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm v') = (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ v')
```
possibly as `simp`


bors d=@j-loreaux

style nit. The `rfl` on it's own line I generally do unless the entire statement fits on a single line. And when an expression takes more than one line, we generally indent the subsequent line an extra two spaces.
```suggestion
    toEuclideanLin M v =
      (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ (WithLp.equiv 2 (n → 𝕜)) v) :=
  rfl
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜) (toEuclideanLin M v) = M *ᵥ WithLp.equiv 2 (n → 𝕜) v := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion toEuclideanLin M ((WithLp.equiv 2 (n→ 𝕜)).symm v) = (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ v) := ```

```suggestion
    WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜) (toEuclideanLin M v) = M *ᵥ WithLp.equiv 2 (n → 𝕜) v :=
```
This suggestion still applies; it seems the bot tricked you into reverting it.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion toEuclideanLin M ((WithLp.equiv 2 (n→ 𝕜)).symm v) = (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ v) := ```

```suggestion
theorem toEuclidean_apply_eq_mulVec (M : Matrix m n 𝕜) (v : EuclideanSpace 𝕜 n) :
   toEuclideanLin M ((WithLp.equiv 2 (n→ 𝕜)).symm v) = (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ v) :=
  rfl
```
I am not sure of the name `toEuclidean_apply_eq_mulVec`, if anyone has one better adhering to convention/more accurately indicating what the lemma says.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion toEuclideanLin M ((WithLp.equiv 2 (n→ 𝕜)).symm v) = (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ v) := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜) (toEuclideanLin M v) = (M *ᵥ (WithLp.equiv 2 (n → 𝕜)) v) := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion toEuclideanLin M ((WithLp.equiv 2 (n→ 𝕜)).symm v) = (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ v) := ```
Since I butchered these changes, Jireh had me revert the state to before the above suggestions were made, and provided names for the lemmas. (Thanks again, man!!!)
This isn't your fault, this is a bug in the bot
Whew! That's a relief. Thanks, Eric!
In fact, I think every one of these bot comments is garbage; it should only be suggesting whitespace changes.

```suggestion
theorem piLp_equiv_toEuclideanLin_apply (M : Matrix m n 𝕜) (v : EuclideanSpace 𝕜 n) :
```

```suggestion
    WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜) (toEuclideanLin M v) = (M *ᵥ (WithLp.equiv 2 (n → 𝕜)) v) :=
  rfl
```

```suggestion
    toEuclideanLin M ((WithLp.equiv 2 (n→ 𝕜)).symm v) = (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ v) :=
  rfl
```

This fits, I checked.
```suggestion
    toEuclideanLin M v = (WithLp.equiv 2 (m → 𝕜)).symm (M *ᵥ (WithLp.equiv 2 (n → 𝕜)) v) :=
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add Lemma `Matrix_toEuclideanLin_apply`
